title: Ticket #427: Make proxy refresh handling consistent in the gridmanager
description:
The gridmanager's handling of forwarding renewed proxies is very inconsistent across the different grid-types. The handling should be made more consistent.

The different behaviors are outlined here:

  • In gt2, the proxy is immediately forwarded to a running jobmanager, but a stopped jobmanager will be restarted only if the old proxy has less than 6 hours of life left.
  • In gt4, the renewed proxy is forwarded if the old proxy has less than 11 hours of life left, and failed attempts are retried at most every 5 minutes.
  • In cream, the renewed proxy is forwarded immediately, and failed attempts are retried at most every 5 minutes.
  • In condor, the renewed proxy is forwarded immediately, and the interval between failed attempts is controlled by GRIDMANAGER_PROXY_REFRESH_INTERVAL.
  • In lsf/pbs, the renewed proxy is forwarded immediately and there's no control of retries on failure.
  • In nordugrid, there is no forwarding of renewed proxies.

Some difference in behavior may be appropriate between systems where forwarding is done per job (gt2, condor, pbs/lsf) vs per site (gt4, cream). In the latter case, more aggressive forwarding is acceptable.
